sense.definition: physically in contact with and supported by (a surface) (e.g., the book on the table)
indicating a surface that, due to contact with, serves as the cause or means of causing something (e.g., cooked on the open flame)
sense.notes: definition is different from 3(1b) but the actual annotations fit better under this one

sense.definition: onto; indicating where (or against what) contact is made (e.g., threw spaghetti on the wall)
indicating the part(s) of the body supporting the rest of the body (e.g., stood on his feet)
indicating the vehicle or mode of transportation (e.g., flew on a plane)
in the possession of; being carried by (e.g., a gun on him)
forming a distinctive or marked part of the surface of (e.g., a smile on his lips)
having (the thing mentioned) as a topic; about (e.g., knowledge on sailing)
having (the thing mentioned) as criteria used in judgment or evaluation or as a/the justification for an action (e.g., judged on his actions)
having (the thing mentioned) as a/the basis for a monetary action (e.g., was charged on his loan)
having (the thing mentioned) as a/the basis being adhered to or system of rules governing an action or situation (e.g., employed on a contract)
indicating a time; at the time of (e.g., happened on Oct. 22nd)
indicating some foodstuff that is being consumed or otherwise forms the basis of a diet/meal (e.g., dined on fine wine)
indicating some substance (e.g., a drug or medicine) one is currently taking or under the influence of (e.g., he is on drugs)
indicating the means/medium used for storing or transmitting information (e.g., talked on the phone)
in the course of (a journey) (e.g., it happened on the way to the store)
indicating an activity engaged in (e.g., he was on a mission)
indicating the target of some action or behavior; metaphorically onto or against (e.g., get revenge on Sam)
denoting a particular level or setting along a scale or range (e.g., set the dryer on Permanent Press)
